items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding in the River Clyst and Culm Area has now reduced. River levels are falling below levels of concern, however there may be standing water seen for several days. Rain is forecast for Thursday and Friday and river levels will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

items.description: Langford and Wendlebury Brooks from Stratton Audley down to near Merton

floodArea.riverOrSea: Audley Brook, Langford Brook, Pingle Stream, Bure, Wendlebury Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.

River levels have risen on the Langford and Wendlebury Brooks as a result of heavy rainfall but are currently falling. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible, especially in the Langford Village area.
 
The forecast today and into tomorrow is for scattered showers.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed and trash screens. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 

This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 20/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.

River levels have fallen on the River Ray, but further heavy rainfall is forecast and levels may rise again in response. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland remains possible, especially in the Islip area. 

The forecast today and into tomorrow is for scattered showers.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed and trash screens. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 

This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 20/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels are falling, but still pose a flood risk. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Further rainfall is forecast overnight and into Thursday 20th May. 
We will continue to monitor the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 

River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. The forecast today is for scattered showers. 

We continue to monitor the situation. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

River levels have risen at the Stinsford river gauge as a result of recent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible over the next 24 hours.  
We expect flooding to affect tributaries between Dorchester and Wareham.
Further showery, at times heavy  rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain highfor at least the next 24 hours.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated Wednesday, 18/5/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message: The risk of flooding has reduced and river levels falling.
